channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Lack of yellow box means all backed up traffic into Cheltenham on the A40 stops southbound traffic trying to pass through roundabout, 17th September
item.description:
Traffic backing up on A40 into Cheltenham is causing blockages on the roundabout for southbound traffic trying to exit Princess Elizabeth Way and get through onto the westbound A40. Every morning the same. Cars just back up at the eastbound A40 bottleneck without anywhere to go, and this causes unnecessary delays to the princess Elizabeth Way traffic trying to get out of Cheltenham. A simple yellow box to make enough room for the two lanes to get on and off the roundabout is desperately required. There’s no reason for it to be so log jammed because other road users can’t work out just how obstructive they are when not being able to exit the roundabout.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhall Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Ambiguous Road markings after road layout change, 17th September
item.description:
Since road layout change at the Park and Ride Roundabout, road marking’s are ambiguous. If coming from KFC and heading to Costa/BMW, the road layout encourages people to still use left hand lane, when in fact it would be better to provide clarification and direct people into the right hand lane. Currently the road markings still say right hand lane for P&R only. Many road users are using both lanes and converging into the exit of the roundabout, which is causing lots of issues on a daily basis.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: I imagine travelling to space is more comfortable than driving along this road in a car., 17th September
item.description:
Isn’t it time the whole road is resurfaced? You can’t avoid them anymore. The next winter will make this road almost undriveable if you want to actually maintain the condition of your car. Is this going to be addressed? No one seems to want to acknowledge this so far despite raising it a few times now?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 141, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign is obscured by overgrown tree, 17th September
item.description:
The sign post is obscured. I took the photo from the centre of the road, giving the view that a car would have as it approaches the round about. They cannot see enough of the sign. This is dangerous if they need to read the directions. The tree is steadily growing and so the problem will become worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Box Junction or Mini Roundabout., 17th September
item.description:
A46 Shurdington Rd junction with Leckhampton Ln Traffic builds up to this junction every day all the way back to the A417. Reason is this junction. A simple fix that would help without having to completely redesign the road would be to install a mini roundabout, and/or a yellow box junction. This wouldn't cost a lot but would be a massive help and improve the lives of hundreds of people every day. A46 through Shurdington needs a large investment and some massive improvements but this would be a simple, easy fix that would make lots of people happy.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.title: Loose and Noisy Fire Hydrant Cover After Second Replacement, 17th September
item.description:
Fire hydrant cover is loose, knocking and loud. Cover and frame was replaced as part of Pirton lane resurfacing. First cover was immediately loose and noisy. Issue reported direct to contractors who replaced cover with alternative. Feedback was new cover may not be good enough as frame may be warped. Contractor advised new cover would be tried before frame replacement was considered. New cover is now loose and noisy again with every car that drives over it. Now causing disruption to local business with continual noise intrusion.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 207, Pirton Lane, Churchdown, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TTLs on green for 2 directions at the same time, 17th September
item.description:
TTLs at the top of Paynes Pitch are on green for traffic from Hucclecote and traffic from Drews Court at the same time. There is no indication that this is happening and I was nearly knocked off my bike proceeding on a green light, unaware that traffic would be approaching from the other direction as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drews Court, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Flytip on Cleeve Common Road - Pylons Butterfly Field Gate area, 17th September
item.description:
The location is to the left of the field gate (see photograph) to the Pylons Butterfly field on Cleeve common road (about 20 yards before the Car Park area. The tipped material consists of electrical appliance, board and other stuff. Across the road on the opposite verge from the tip is also more rubbish. Please can this be cleared up as soon as possible.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
